memberdef.argsstring: (const q7_t *pV, const q7_t *pM, const uint16_t dim_vec, const uint16_t num_of_rows, const uint16_t bias_shift, const uint16_t out_shift, const q7_t *bias, q7_t *pOut, q15_t *vec_buffer)
memberdef.name: riscv_fully_connected_q7_opt

parameterdescription.para: number of rows in weight matrix
pointer to buffer space for input

detaileddescription.para: This opt function is designed to work with interleaved weight matrix. The vector input is assumed in q7_t format, we call riscv_q7_to_q15_no_shift_shuffle function to expand into q15_t format with certain weight re-ordering, refer to the function comments for more details. Here we use only one pointer to read 4 rows in the weight matrix. So if the original q7_t matrix looks like this:
We operates on multiple-of-4 rows, so the first four rows becomes
So within the kernel, we first read the re-ordered vector in as:
the four q31_t weights will look like
The column left over will be in-order. which is:
For the left-over rows, we do 1x1 computation, so the data remains as its original order.
So the stored weight matrix looks like this:
